zmod_equiv_trunc_compat:
theorem zmod_equiv_trunc_compat (kâ‚ kâ‚‚ : â„•) (hk : kâ‚ â‰¤ kâ‚‚) :
    (truncated_witt_vector.truncate hk).comp ((zmod_equiv_trunc p kâ‚‚).to_ring_hom.comp (padic_int.to_zmod_pow kâ‚‚)) =
      (zmod_equiv_trunc p kâ‚).to_ring_hom.comp (padic_int.to_zmod_pow kâ‚) :=
  by rw [â† RingHom.comp_assoc, commutes, RingHom.comp_assoc, padic_int.zmod_cast_comp_to_zmod_pow]
#align zmod_equiv_trunc_compat zmod_equiv_trunc_compat
zmod_equiv_trunc_apply:
theorem zmod_equiv_trunc_apply {x : ZMod (p ^ n)} :
    zmod_equiv_trunc p n x = ZMod.castHom (by rfl) (truncated_witt_vector p n (ZMod p)) x :=
  rfl
#align zmod_equiv_trunc_apply zmod_equiv_trunc_apply
to_zmod_pow_compat:
theorem to_zmod_pow_compat (m n : â„•) (h : m â‰¤ n) :
    (ZMod.castHom (pow_dvd_pow p h) (ZMod (p ^ m))).comp (to_zmod_pow p n) = to_zmod_pow p m :=
  calc
    (ZMod.castHom _ (ZMod (p ^ m))).comp ((zmod_equiv_trunc p n).symm.to_ring_hom.comp (truncate n)) =
        ((zmod_equiv_trunc p m).symm.to_ring_hom.comp (truncated_witt_vector.truncate h)).comp (truncate n) :=
      by rw [commutes_symm, RingHom.comp_assoc]
    _ = (zmod_equiv_trunc p m).symm.to_ring_hom.comp (truncate m) := by
      rw [RingHom.comp_assoc, truncate_comp_witt_vector_truncate]
    
#align to_zmod_pow_compat to_zmod_pow_compat
to_padic_int_comp_from_padic_int_ext:

theorem to_padic_int_comp_from_padic_int_ext (x) :
    (to_padic_int p).comp (from_padic_int p) x = RingHom.id (Â«exprâ„¤_[ ]Â» p) x := by

to_padic_int_comp_from_padic_int:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«exprâ„¤_[ ]Â» -/
theorem to_padic_int_comp_from_padic_int : (to_padic_int p).comp (from_padic_int p) = RingHom.id (Â«exprâ„¤_[ ]Â» p) :=
  by
  rw [â† padic_int.to_zmod_pow_eq_iff_ext]
  intro n
  rw [â† RingHom.comp_assoc, to_padic_int, padic_int.lift_spec]
  simp only [from_padic_int, to_zmod_pow, RingHom.comp_id]

#align from_padic_int_comp_to_padic_int from_padic_int_comp_to_padic_int
eq_of_le_of_cast_pow_eq_zero:
/-
Copyright (c) 2020 Johan Commelin. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Johan Commelin, Robert Y. Lewis
-/
theorem eq_of_le_of_cast_pow_eq_zero [CharP R p] (i : â„•) (hin : i â‰¤ n)
    (hpi : (p ^ i : truncated_witt_vector p n R) = 0) : i = n :=
  by
  contrapose! hpi
  replace hin := lt_of_le_of_ne hin hpi
  clear hpi
  have : (â†‘p ^ i : truncated_witt_vector p n R) = witt_vector.truncate n (â†‘p ^ i) := by
    rw [RingHom.map_pow, map_natCast]
  rw [this, ext_iff, not_forall]
  clear this
  use âŸ¨i, hinâŸ©
  rw [witt_vector.coeff_truncate, coeff_zero, Fin.val_mk, witt_vector.coeff_p_pow]
  haveI : Nontrivial R := CharP.nontrivial_of_char_ne_one hp.1.ne_one
  exact one_ne_zero
#align eq_of_le_of_cast_pow_eq_zero eq_of_le_of_cast_pow_eq_zero
commutes_symm':
theorem commutes_symm' {m : â„•} (hm : n â‰¤ m) (x : truncated_witt_vector p m (ZMod p)) :
    (zmod_equiv_trunc p n).symm (truncate hm x) = ZMod.castHom (pow_dvd_pow p hm) _ ((zmod_equiv_trunc p m).symm x) :=
  by
  apply (zmod_equiv_trunc p n).injective
  rw [â† commutes']
  simp
#align commutes_symm' commutes_symm'
commutes_symm:
/-- The following diagram commutes:
```text
truncated_witt_vector p n (zmod p) ----> truncated_witt_vector p m (zmod p)
            |                                        |
            |                                        |
            v                                        v
          zmod (p^n) ----------------------------> zmod (p^m)
```
Here the vertical arrows are `(truncated_witt_vector.zmod_equiv_trunc p _).symm`,
the horizontal arrow at the top is `zmod.cast_hom`,
and the horizontal arrow at the bottom is `truncated_witt_vector.truncate`.
-/
theorem commutes_symm {m : â„•} (hm : n â‰¤ m) :
    (zmod_equiv_trunc p n).symm.to_ring_hom.comp (truncate hm) =
      (ZMod.castHom (pow_dvd_pow p hm) _).comp (zmod_equiv_trunc p m).symm.to_ring_hom :=
  by ext <;> apply commutes_symm'
#align commutes_symm commutes_symm
commutes':
theorem commutes' {m : â„•} (hm : n â‰¤ m) (x : ZMod (p ^ m)) :
    truncate hm (zmod_equiv_trunc p m x) = zmod_equiv_trunc p n (ZMod.castHom (pow_dvd_pow p hm) _ x) :=
  show (truncate hm).comp (zmod_equiv_trunc p m).to_ring_hom x = _ by rw [commutes _ _ hm] <;> rfl
#align commutes' commutes'
commutes:
/-- The following diagram commutes:
```text
          zmod (p^n) ----------------------------> zmod (p^m)
            |                                        |
            |                                        |
            v                                        v
truncated_witt_vector p n (zmod p) ----> truncated_witt_vector p m (zmod p)
```
Here the vertical arrows are `truncated_witt_vector.zmod_equiv_trunc`,
the horizontal arrow at the top is `zmod.cast_hom`,
and the horizontal arrow at the bottom is `truncated_witt_vector.truncate`.
-/
theorem commutes {m : â„•} (hm : n â‰¤ m) :
    (truncate hm).comp (zmod_equiv_trunc p m).to_ring_hom =
      (zmod_equiv_trunc p n).to_ring_hom.comp (ZMod.castHom (pow_dvd_pow p hm) _) :=
  RingHom.ext_zmod _ _
#align commutes commutes
char_p_zmod:
theorem char_p_zmod : CharP (truncated_witt_vector p n (ZMod p)) (p ^ n) :=
  charP_of_prime_pow_injective _ _ _ (card_zmod _ _) (eq_of_le_of_cast_pow_eq_zero p n (ZMod p))
#align char_p_zmod char_p_zmod
card_zmod:
theorem card_zmod : Fintype.card (truncated_witt_vector p n (ZMod p)) = p ^ n := by rw [card, ZMod.card]
#align card_zmod card_zmod
